metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26147 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 5.8.9. The WEP, WPA, WPA2, andWPA3 implementations reassemble fragments even though some of them weresent in plaintext. This vulnerability can be abused to inject packetsand/or exfiltrate selected fragments when another device sends fragmentedframes and the WEP, CCMP, or GCMP data-confidentiality protocol is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-151.157').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1').
